newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RGC eyes Victoria mineral sands search.
newsitem.headline: RGC eyes Victoria mineral sands search.

text.p: RGC Ltd said on Thursday it expects to explore for rutile and zircon over 24,000 square km in Australia's Victoria state.

RGC's wholly-owned subsidiary, RGC Mineral Sands Ltd, has applied to the state's Department of Natural Resources and Environment for about 40 exploration licenses in the Ouyen area, RGC exploration manager Peter McGoldrick told Reuters.
He said RGC is one of the world's largest mineral sand miners.
In Australia RGC mines mineral sands in Western Australia and Queensland. In the U.S. it operates one mine in Florida and is developing a second in Virginia.
It also owns 76.7 percent of Cudgen Resources RZ Ltd, which holds 50 percent of Consolidated Rutile Ltd.
Consolidated Rutile's main asset is 50 percent of the Sierra Rutile Ltd mine in Sierra Leone.
Mineral sand products are largely used in the pigment and ceramics industries.
